Class: TurtleComponentState

TurtleComponentState(name, value, component)

Represents a state for a Turtle component. It holds the state name, value, and manages updates when the state changes.

Constructor

new TurtleComponentState(name, value, component)

Creates an instance of TurtleComponentState.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
name string

The name of the state.
value *

The initial value of the state.
component Object

The component that the state is associated with.

Classes

TurtleComponentState

Methods

get() → {*}

Retrieves the current value of the state.

Returns:

The current value of the state.

Type
*

set(value) → {*}

Sets a new value for the state and triggers a component update if it's reactive.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
value *

The new value to set for the state.
Returns:

The updated value.

Type
*

sync(context, key) → {TurtleComponentState}

Synchronizes the state with a given context and key, establishing a binding.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
context Object

The context to bind the state to.
key string

The key under which the state will be bound in the context.
Returns:

The instance of the state for chaining.

Type
TurtleComponentState
